headline.main: FOGGIA IS ATTACKED; None of 150 U.S. Planes Is Lost in Raids on 2 Italian Cities

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN NORTH AFRICA, May 31 -- Naples, the chief supply port for Italy's island outposts in the Mediterranean and a center of war industry in Southern Italy, was heavily bombed yesterday without loss by more than 100 Flying Fortresses in the biggest daylight raid yet directed against the city. Widespread damage was inflicted in the course of the attack on objectives in Naples and the immediate vicinity.
abstract: Ital area action: 100 Flying Fortresses raid Naples; Pomigliano plane factory reptd hit; Foggia raided; many grounded planes destroyed; Sardinia points bombed; Naples harbor battered
